Comments_List: Research methods, thesis supervision and managing sources

It was interesting to hear from a range of professors from different disciplines and using different methods. I gained an insight into some of these different methods in a way which has informed my own work. I believe it also helped me shape what I am interested in pursuing in the future.
It could be divided into different sections and give the student the option to select the section that is of interest and help according to his academic needs.

Strengths and weaknesses are mostly in balance. The course is very much self driven which creates learning opportunities. It forces students to think about the thesis work early on. But on the other hand, it is a lonely process.

I really enjoyed most of the sessions but some discussions were more lively than others and more relevant to certain members of the group than others. But I'm not sure that this is something that can be changed about the course. I especially enjoyed the session on academic writing - the article was very thought provoking and the discussion interesting and helpful - and the first few sessions. These were helpful across my other courses.
Recommended to students of the European Studies.
